statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: HALL OF FAME TIP-OFF TOURNAMENT AT SPRINGFIELD MA

article.description: Sammy Yeager scored 19 points and TCU defeated Bradley 74-68 Sunday in the Hall of Fame Tip-Off Classic.
article.headline: Sammy Yeager leads way as TCU takes down Bradley
article.linkText: Yeager leads way as TCU takes down Bradley
article.story: SPRINGFIELD, Mass. -- Sammy Yeager scored 19 points and TCU defeated Bradley 74-68 Sunday in the Hall of Fame Tip-Off Classic. Hank Thorns added his second double-double of the season -- 11 points and 10 assists -- and scored seven of his points in the final 1:22, when the game was decided. He started with a 3-pointer that gave the Horned Frogs (3-1) a 65-62 lead. Thorns was also responsible for four of the eight consecutive free throws TCU made down the stretch. Andrew Warren led the Braves (4-1) with 24 points and 10 rebounds. Eighteen of his points came in the second half. The game featured six ties and 10 lead changes, with neither team able to build a double-digit advantage. Bradley led by as many as four points; TCU's largest margin was eight. Ronnie Moss added 16 points for TCU, 11 in the second half.
